Jedidiah can introduce you to 3 people at Kingman Unified School District #20
Jedidiah worked at Kingman Unified School District #20

With Amazon I develop internal learning experiences for world-wide audiences through games, videos and in-depth documentation. I stretch to not only exceed stakeholder expectations, but to delight learners with content that is fun, beautiful and highly polished. I never build walls of text into PowerPoint presentations. Instead, I work backward to understand what learners need to be able to do after completing training so that my work will grab and hold their attention, and ultimately change their behavior. Best of all, I'm constantly given opportunity to expand and polish my skill set to create content with the latest tools and languages. There's no reason training shouldn't look gorgeous, elicit laughter, and meet the web's standards for user experience.
Instructional Designer and e-Learning Developer at King County EMS

With EMS Online I wore many hats. Officially, I was an Instructional Designer and e-Learning developer. However, due to both the small nature of the team and ambitious projects, I stepped into multiple roles including: project manager, writer, videographer, UI/UX designer, business analyst, programmer, illustrator, and more. During my time there I had the pleasure of working with some incredibly intelligent and talented doctors, EMTs and Paramedics to design, develop, transform and hone EMS Online's course offerings into solid, impactful learning opportunities.

Every day was unique for me at MCC as a designer and driver of sound pedagogy and content delivery. Behind the scenes I came up with effective teaching strategies, executed creative designs from storyboard to reality, and translated technical concepts and tools for staff, faculty and students alike.* Designed and built a comprehensive, interactive, self-paced online training course for new faculty utilizing Articulate Studio, Camtasia and Adobe Premier.* Facilitated the successful launch of the Center for Excellence in Learning and Teaching with engaging training/development centers and classrooms across four campuses.* Provide leadership in the assessment and improvement of online, hybrid and ground courses through technical, instructional, and andragogical support.

* Developed and executed multiple synchronous and asynchronous trainings on SharePoint, WebCT, and best practices in teaching and learning. * Assisted faculty in reviewing and improving online courses.* Assisted in development of a comprehensive online faculty development course.

Plan for, evaluate, and implement new technologies to assist in the facilitation and delivery of distance education programs. Manage current delivery platforms including interactive television and the ANGEL LMS to deliver both synchronous and asynchronous education to students. Assist and train faculty in the use of educational technologies, troubleshooting issues and acting as main point of contact with external vendors.* Project lead and change manager for LMS upgrade.* Generate customized SQL reports for state and internal reporting purposes.* Conduct extensive research on LMS options leading two successful pilot programs.* Spearheaded and managed the college's distance education Facebook page.

Taught English reading, writing and speaking skills to Korean students in grade levels 4-6. Interacted with native Korean faculty to develop engaging supplemental lessons.* Developed valuable experience working within a foreign culture and overcoming language barriers.* Instructed at several English language camps.

With Tempe Elementary School District:* Assisted classroom teachers addressing a variety of learning and behavioral challenges.* Provided coaching for English as a Second Language students teaching basic phonetic, reading, and speaking skills.* Completed CPR, First Aid, and non-violent crisis intervention training.

*  Developed comprehensive and engaging lesson plans. *  Coordinated with colleagues to ensure curricula aligned with state and federal standards. *  Contributed to an increase in math scores on the AIMS test.*  Assisted colleagues in use of new grading and attendance software, as well as a variety of other technical and computer issues.

Learning Experience Designer at Amazon
December 1, 2016, Jedidiah worked with Minae in the same group

Advocate of the learner, Storyline expert, and mentor – are words that come to my mind when I think about Jed. In the past year at Amazon, I’ve collaborated with Jed and have looked to him for guidance and feedback during design phases on a number of my projects. I am astounded by Jed’s intuitive awareness of learners. He's helped me think through learning experiences from the users' perspective, always first in mind, which resulted in improved learning structure, interactions, and visual interfaces. No matter how dull the content is, Jed uses his witty sense of humor and applies user-centered design thinking to create engaging user experiences and provokes the user's curiosity. Jed would be a strong asset to any team seeking a creative, technologically-apt, and systematic thinker and doer.

Crafting Digital Learning Experiences at Amazon
August 11, 2016, Melissa worked with Jedidiah in different groups

When I first moved to Seattle from Philadelphia I did not know too many Instructional Designers in the area. Jed made me feel welcome by reaching out to me for lunch. We soon paired up to create even more of a community for learning professionals in the area. Jed is proactive in his approach to learning. He is always testing new technologies and methodologies to push the bar in the field of learning. I had been working in a game engine and Jed was interested to try it out. He was able to get a platformer game in the works in less than an afternoon. I am constantly impressed by Jed's work; from illustrations, to e-learning, to videos in After Effects, AND he makes sure to create effective user experiences in all of his work.

June 30, 2011, Lale worked with Jedidiah in different groups

My professional experience with Jed Esposito spans my career at Mohave Community College as a faculty member and as division chair of Career and Technical Education.  Jed has always been a very knowledgeable, professional, and pleasant individual to work with, and I have had nothing but positive experiences in dealing with him.  As the Distance Education Technology Administrator at MCC, Jed has managed the college’s Angel Learning Management System very well, integrating the distance education model with the college’s on-ground and hybrid class delivery structure, in addition to providing support for the ITV system.  Jed Esposito has been an invaluable asset to Mohave Community College; I believe that his experience and background which successfully incorporates instructional technology with higher education pedagogy, particularly in a learning-centered environment, make him a very strong candidate.  I recommend him highly.  Please feel free to contact me for additional details anytime.

Chandler Rudd
Learning Architect
April 25, 2017, Jedidiah reported directly to Chandler

It's difficult to write a review for Chandler because he's the kind of leader who shines across multiple categories. To fully describe his mastery in one area would bring me to the character limit of this form. I'll try to be brief.I was blessed to receive Chandler's inspiration and encouragement over the course of three years at Amazon while supporting a multitude of Global HRS initiatives. During this time his calm, thoughtful character, deep (seriously, deep) understanding of learner needs, and high standards impressed me and helped to define the trajectory of my own career.I think a large portion of Chandler's success can be chalked up to experience and natural gifting, but what really sticks with me, and what made me want to do my utmost each day, was his willingness to dive into the unknown to invent and simplify. Far from picking up a skill here and there, Chandler pursued a level of mastery with new tools and technology that enabled him to produce truly beautiful and usable learning experiences that changed learner behavior. Not only did he lead, he dove in and did the work to a masterful level.While I continue to miss his leadership and professional guidance, I know he's making a massive impact where he is now. If you're considering him for any kind of learning or leadership role - your search is over. Please contact me if you'd like more information on any of the qualities I've touched on here.

July 7, 2016, Jedidiah worked with Melissa in different groups

There's a reason you found Mel's profile, and it isn't just because she's a fantastic and well-known blogger in the online learning space. I've had the pleasure of working with Mel indirectly over the last year and can confidently say that I've never met anyone so completely immersed in the world of meeting learner needs. From her methodology in approaching learning problems all the way through to her brazen head-first willingness to (and aptitude for) using new tools and technologies, she doesn't fail to impress. best of all, she's a team player, consistently reaching across to coach and support her coworkers, colleagues and professional following through their own projects. That said, you should go away now, because I don't want her leaving.
